bibl.title: Shattered Lives and Broken Childhoods: Evidence of Physical Child Abuse in Ancient Egypt.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Materials and methods: 2.1. Dakhleh Oasis, Egypt and Kellis; - 2.2. Kellis 2 cemetery and Burial 519; - 2.3. Macroscopic, radiologic, histologic and isotopic analysis. - 3. Results: 3.1. Macroscopic analysis and radiography; - 3.2. Micro-CT and histology. - 4. Discussion: 4.1. Clinical comparisons; - 4.2. Differential diagnosis; - 4.3. Historical and archaeological comparisons. - 5. Conclusions. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Sandra M. Wheeler, Lana Williams, Patrick Beauchesne & Tosha L. Dupras, Shattered Lives and Broken Childhoods: Evidence of Physical Child Abuse in Ancient Egypt.
